intro: Hypodiscus montanus, commonly known as the mountain hypodiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas, thriving in cool, moist climates. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The flowers, which bloom in late spring, are usually pink or purple and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
